item.title: Using Sieve of Eratosthenes to find prime numbers
item.description: Mathedemo MathJax.Hub.Config({tex2jax: {inlineMath: [['$','$'], ['\\(','\\)']]}}); We know a prime number is a natural number greater than 1 has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself. If Someone asks you, “What are all prime numbers less than 1 million?”, how can you answer the question? There are many algorithms to find all prime numbers up to any given limit. I’m going to cover the Sieve of Eratosthenes, a simple but powerful algorithm, in this article.
